definition: to swear an oath (of office)/to make a vow
to swear the oath of office

pinyin: xuan1 shi4 gong4 ci2 zheng4 ming2

sentences.english: Japan's new foreign minister sworn in .
sentences.chinese: 日本新外相松本刚明宣誓就职。

sentences.english: And stop with the off-topic arguments and swearing.
sentences.chinese: 和停止题外话参数并宣誓就职。

sentences.english: However this year the police have vowed to arrest them for indecent exposure.
sentences.chinese: 然而，今年警方宣誓以不恰当暴露罪逮捕他们。

sentences.english: The detectives swore out a search warrant.
sentences.chinese: 侦探宣誓所控属实后领到一张搜查证。

sentences.english: The chief method is to take depositions of parties and witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 主要的方法是录取当事人和证人的宣誓证言。

sentences.english: She swore out a warrant for the arrest of the man who stole her car.
sentences.chinese: 她宣誓所控属实，因此领到了偷她车那个人的逮捕证。

sentences.english: Polish Pope John Paul II then pledged his obedience to the Freemasons.
sentences.chinese: 波兰籍的约翰保罗二世随后宣誓对共济会效忠。

sentences.english: Swear your fealty to the Wizard's Throne.
sentences.chinese: 请在巫师王座面前，宣誓你的忠诚。

sentences.english: "And didn't you swear allegiance to this country when you became a citizen?" she asked.
sentences.chinese: “当时你没宣誓对这个国家效忠么？”她问。

sentences.english: Each of you are part of this oath.
sentences.chinese: 你们每个人都有参与这项宣誓。

sentences.english: So let the council swear publicly.
sentences.chinese: 那就让贵族议事会公开宣誓。

sentences.english: Compurgation was used frequently in manorial courts.
sentences.chinese: 宣誓断案通常用于采邑法庭。

sentences.english: I swear that, from now on, I will treasure rather than underestimate myself.
sentences.chinese: 我宣誓，从今往后，让我珍视自己不再妄自菲薄。

sentences.english: We, who have taken the vow of chastity, have our sensuous problems.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经宣誓守贞，但也有着感官欲望的问题。

definition: to read out loud to an audience/a prepared speech (e.g. to a party conference)
to vow loyalty and devotion to
